meanings.definition: Not previously known or used; new or different.
meanings.sent1: The bakery had a fresh batch of cookies this morning.
meanings.sent2: She bought a fresh dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a picnic in the library was fresh.
meanings.sent4: His perspective on the situation was as fresh as a spring breeze.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers filled the room.

meanings.definition: Recently made or obtained; not canned, frozen, or otherwise preserved.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a fresh salad with organic ingredients.
meanings.sent2: I prefer fresh fruit over canned fruit.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told was as fresh as a just-baked pie.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as fresh as a morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the walls looked fresh and vibrant.

meanings.definition: Lively and invigorating; not tired or worn out.
meanings.sent1: The fresh music at the party got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: After a good night's sleep, she felt fresh and ready for the day.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's energy was so fresh, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was as fresh as a summer breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze was fresh and rejuvenating.
